programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Denver claimed wins over Los Angeles in two of their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on March 14 with a 131-126 score; Nikola Jokić posted 28 points and 7 rebounds for the Nuggets in 38 minutes played of the win.

programme.title: NBA Basketball

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Preliminary round of the NCAA DI Wrestling Championships which will decide the final spots for the main bracket starting on March 21; Penn State claimed the 2024 edition of the tournament over second-place Cornell with a score of 172.5.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Liberty (26-6) makes its first appearance since 2018 after winning the Conference USA Tournament behind MVP Bella Smuda; Kentucky (22-7) is NCAA Tournament bound in its first season under head coach Kenny Brooks behind Georgia Amoore.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Tennessee Tech (26-5) comes off its best regular season since 1989-90), and won 17 straight after winning the Ohio Valley Tournament; South Carolina (30-3) looks to defend its national title and win its third in the last four years.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Stephen F. Austin (29-5) won the Southland Tournament to earn its berth; Notre Dame (26-5) makes its fourth-straight appearance and 28th in the last 29 possible seasons behind Hannah Hildago, who was fourth in the country in scoring at 24.2 ppg.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Nebraska (21-11) plays in its third NCAA Tournament in the last four years; Louisville (21-10) makes its 14th-straight appearance, tied with Maryland for the fourth-longest active streak, and the Cardinals are 40-15 in the tournament under Jeff Walz.

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Championship round of the DI Men's Wrestling Championships at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania after the semi-finals round on March 21; Penn State won the 2024 edition of the tournament ahead of second-place Cornell with a 172.5.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: Analyst and SportsCenter anchor Elle Duncan is joined by experts Rebecca Lobo and Andraya Carter as they discuss the upcoming action in the 2024 Women's NCAA Tournament with breakdowns of matchups and keys to the game with highlights and analysis.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Norfolk State (30-4) enters on a 19-game winning streak after winning the MEAC Tournament to secure its first 30-win season in program history; Maryland (23-7) makes its 14th-straight appearance, tied for the fourth longest active streak.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: The GameDay crew goes on the road to various locations at different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the week, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Murray State (25-7) earned its first berth since 2008 after winning the Missouri Valley Tournament behind MVP Katelyn Young; Iowa (22-10) makes its seventh-straight appearance, advancing to the national title game the last two years.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: USF (23-10) earned its ninth berth in the last 12 possible seasons after winning the AAC Tournament behind MVP Carla Brito; Tennessee (22-9) makes its 43rd-straight appearance, the only team to play in every year of the tournament.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Vermont (21-12) earned its second berth in the last three years after winning the America East Tournament behind Nikola Priede; NC State (26-6) makes its eighth-straight appearance, and will look to build upon its trip to the Final Four last year.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UCLA, USC, defending champion South Carolina and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in their respective regional brackets, as 68 teams battle it out in the single-elimination tournament to crown a national champion in women's college basketball.

programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Loyola Chicago (22-11) makes its third postseason appearance in the first four seasons under head coach Drew Valentine; San Jose State (15-19) earned its first NIT berth since 1981, and is hosting a postseason game for the first time.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Detroit beat Miami in their last two consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Dec. 16, 125-124, after overtime; Houston's Malik Beasley posted 28 points in the win while Cade Cunningham added a 20-point, 18-assist triple-double.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Northern Iowa (20-12) makes its 20th trip to the postseason and first since the 2022 NIT; SMU (23-10) makes its seventh postseason in the last 11 possible years in its first year under head coach Andy Enfield and the first season as an ACC member.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Washington (19-13) makes its first tournament appearance since 2017 in its first season as a Big Ten member; Columbia (23-6) earned its second-straight at-large berth, the only two times the Lions have played in the NCAA Tournament.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: William & Mary (17-15) makes its first tournament appearance in program history after winning the CAA Tournament behind Bella Nascimento; High Point (21-11) earned its first berth since 2021 after winning the Big South Tournament.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Fairleigh Dickinson (29-3) earned its first berth in program history after winning the NEC Tournament, and enters on a 22-win streak; TCU (31-3) makes its first appearance since 2010, and its No. 2 seed is the highest in program history.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in China; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The top 10 European fighters in UFC history are examined and profiled, showcasing how these hard-hitting brawlers carved their names into the annals of legend; highlights share how these battle-hardened combatants cemented their legacies.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Montana State (30-3) secured its first 30-win season in program history after winning the Big Sky Tournament behind Esmeralda Morales; Ohio State (25-6) makes its fourth-straight appearance and eight in the last 10 possible seasons.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the sprint race at the Chinese Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Lando Norris gained an early seven-point lead over Max Verstappen after winning at Australia.

programme.title: All Access: ACC Life
programme.desc: Cameras give a unique glimpse of a day in the life of ACC student-athletes, coaches and staff, showing how the players spend time off the field and the challenges that come with managing their time each day between athletics and academics.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UCLA, USC, defending champion South Carolina and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in their respective regional brackets, as 68 teams battle it out in the single-elimination tournament to crown a national champion in women's college basketball.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Indiana (19-12) makes its sixth-straight appearance and seventh under Teri Moren; Utah (22-8) plays in the NCAA Tournament for a fourth-straight year, tying its longest streak in program history when the Utes went from 1995 to 1998.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: South Dakota State (29-3) earned its 13th berth in the last 16 possible seasons after winning the Summit League Tournament behind Paige Mayer; Oklahoma State (25-6) makes its second appearance in the first three seasons under Jacie Hoyt.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Green Bay (29-5) enters on a 22-game win streak after claiming the Horizon League Tournament in its first season under Kayla Karius; Alabama (23-8) makes its fourth appearance in the last five seasons after a tournament drought dating back to 1999.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at college basketball games around the country, as they review highlights of some of the top moments, profile the top players, analyze the strengths and weaknesses of competing teams, and more.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: The top collegiate hip hop dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Semifinals round of the DI Men's Wrestling Championships at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania after the first three sessions; Penn State claimed the 2024 edition of the tournament ahead of second-place Cornell with a 172.5 score.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Chinese Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Lando Norris gained an early seven-point lead over Max Verstappen after winning the opener at Australia.

programme.title: Fab Five
programme.desc: Jalen Rose, Juwan Howard, Jimmy King, Ray Jackson and coaches discuss their time at the University of Michigan, reliving the recruitment process that brought the Fab Five together in 1991 and their two appearances in the NCAA Championship Game.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: George Mason (27-5) earned its first berth in program history after winning the Atlantic 10 Tournament behind Zahirah Walton; Florida State (23-8) makes its 12th-straight appearance behind Ta'Niya Latson, who led the country in scoring with 24.9 ppg.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Mississippi State (21-11) earned its second berth in the first three seasons under Sam Purcell; Cal (25-8) makes its first appearance since 2019 in its first season as a member of the ACC, and face the Bulldogs for the first time.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Dave Gavitt, a former basketball coach at Providence, was the driving force behind the creation of the Big East Conference in 1979, which flourished in the 1980s and became one of the most highly respected basketball conferences in the country.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Renowned fishing champion Jimmy Houston travels around the world fishing for largemouth bass, crappie and other fish, and he demonstrates his hunting techniques with other athletes, celebrities and friends who love to fish.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Directors Lisa Lax, Hannah Storm and Nancy Winters take an in-depth look at the fierce rivalry between Chris Evert and Martina Navratilova, two tennis players who would face each other on the court 80 times and forge a lasting friendship.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: A maximum field of 296 of the world's top bowlers compete for an $86,000 purse with the winner taking home $20,000 and the runner-up receiving $13,500; EJ Tackett of Blufton, Ind. enters the competition atop the PBA World Championship standings.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Big East Tournament Pregame
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming Big East Tournament game, focusing on the key players to watch on the court and how the two teams fared against each other in the regular season to see which team holds the advantage going into the matchup.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Roki Sasaki appeared in two spring training games for the Dodgers and recorded seven strikeouts over seven innings with a 0.00 ERA; Justin Steele threw 134.2 innings in 24 starts for the Cubs last season, and he was 5-5 with a 3.07 ERA.
